title: Why is it called a wake when someone dies? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because, originally, friends and family spent the night and often the next day surrounding the body and the funeral was immediately after that because, with no real capacity to preserve bodies, they had to be buried fast. It is called a wake because you stayed awake in order to be with the dead one. Word with the same meaning in French. (It is called ‘veiller au corps’ in French Canada).
